head.title: National Briefing | Mid-Atlantic: Maryland: From Baseball To Bivalves

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | Mid-Atlantic: Maryland: From Baseball To Bivalves

abstract.p: Maryland Natural Resources Department to use 8,000 cubic yards of concrete from demolished Memorial Stadium, Baltimore, to create reef in Chesapeake Bay, where it will plant over four million baby oysters; seeks to boost oyster population devastated by disease (S)

block.p: Rubble from the demolished Memorial Stadium in Baltimore will be used to create a reef in Chesapeake Bay, where the state plans to plant more than four million baby oysters. The Department of Natural Resources plans to use 8,000 cubic yards of concrete from the stadium to create a sanctuary for oysters. State officials hope creation of the reef, expected this summer, will help them achieve a tenfold increase this decade in the bay's oyster population, which has been devastated by disease.
